Package core

Interface HlaPayloadUpdater

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HlaDynamicalEntityUpdater, HlaHLAobjectRootUpdater, HlaPhysicalEntityUpdater
    public interface HlaPayloadUpdater
extends HlaDynamicalEntityUpdater
    Updater used to update attribute values.

    This class is ThreadSafe as defined by Java Concurrency in Practice, see jcip.net.

    • Method Detail

      • setPosition

        HlaPayloadUpdater setPosition​(double[] position)
        Set the position for this update.
        Description from the FOM: 3-Vector that specifies the position of the launcher
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the translational position of one point with respect to another. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.
        Parameters:
        position - the new position
        Returns:
        this updater

      • setVelocity

        HlaPayloadUpdater setVelocity​(double[] velocity)
        Set the velocity for this update.
        Description from the FOM: payload velocity
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the time derivative of the vector position of some point with respect to another as seen by an observer fixed in some reference frame. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the observer frame of reference, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.
        Parameters:
        velocity - the new velocity
        Returns:
        this updater

      • setInertia

        HlaPayloadUpdater setInertia​(double[] inertia)
        Set the inertia for this update.
        Description from the FOM: A 3x3 matrix that specifies the centroid moments and coefficients of inertia with respect to the coordinate axes of the DynamicalEntity's body frame
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A 3x3 matrix that specifies the mass inertia matrix of a body about some coordinate axes. The nine elements of the matrix are stored row-wise, namely: Ixx, Ixy, Ixz, Iyx, Iyy, Iyz, Izx, Izy, Izz. The off-diagonal components Iij (i!=j) are the so-called 'negative integrals'. This means that the elements in this inertia matrix satisfy the equation H=Iw. Where H is the angular momentum vector, I is the inertia matrix and w is the angular velocity vector. This data type does not specify the coordinate axes about which the moments are calculated.
        Specified by:
        setInertia in interface HlaDynamicalEntityUpdater
        Parameters:
        inertia - the new inertia
        Returns:
        this updater

      • setInertiaRate

        HlaPayloadUpdater setInertiaRate​(double[] inertiaRate)
        Set the inertiaRate for this update.
        Description from the FOM: A 3x3 matrix that specifies the time rate of change of the parameters in the InertiaMatrix. The elements in this matrix correspond directly to the elements in the InteriaMatrix.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A 3x3 matrix that specifies the time rate of change of the parameters in the InertiaMatrix. The elements in this matrix correspond directly to the elements in the InteriaMatrix.
        Specified by:
        setInertiaRate in interface HlaDynamicalEntityUpdater
        Parameters:
        inertiaRate - the new inertiaRate
        Returns:
        this updater

      • setState

        HlaPayloadUpdater setState​(SpaceTimeCoordinateState state)
        Set the state for this update.
        Description from the FOM: A four dimensional representation of the entity's translational and rotational state with respect to its parent reference frame.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A multi-dimensional representation of an observational coordinate frame and associated state. There are three spatial dimensions, three attitude dimensions and one time dimension. The spatial and attitude components define a right-handed orthogonal set of coordinate axes that constitute a reference frame. The time dimension specifies the 'position' of the coordinate with respect to the physical time scale (TT).
        Specified by:
        setState in interface HlaDynamicalEntityUpdater
        Specified by:
        setState in interface HlaPhysicalEntityUpdater
        Parameters:
        state - the new state
        Returns:
        this updater

      • setAcceleration

        HlaPayloadUpdater setAcceleration​(double[] acceleration)
        Set the acceleration for this update.
        Description from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the acceleration of the entity body frame origin (i.e., the entity's center of mass) with respect to the parent reference frame. This is the time derivative of the velocity vector as seen by an observer fixed in the parent frame. The components of this vector are resolved onto the coordinate axes of the parent frame.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the time derivative of a vector velocity of some point with respect to another as seen by an observer fixed in some reference frame. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the observer frame of reference, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.
        Specified by:
        setAcceleration in interface HlaDynamicalEntityUpdater
        Specified by:
        setAcceleration in interface HlaPhysicalEntityUpdater
        Parameters:
        acceleration - the new acceleration
        Returns:
        this updater

      • setRotationalAcceleration

        HlaPayloadUpdater setRotationalAcceleration​(double[] rotationalAcceleration)
        Set the rotationalAcceleration for this update.
        Description from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the angular acceleration of the entity body frame with respect to the parent reference frame. This is the time derivative of the angular velocity vector as seen by an observer fixed in the parent frame. The components of this vector are resolved onto the coordinate axes of the entity body frame.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the time derivative of an angular velocity vector as seen by an observer fixed in some reference frame. This data type does not specify which angular velocity, nor does it specify the observer frame of reference, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.
        Specified by:

      • setCenterOfMass

        HlaPayloadUpdater setCenterOfMass​(double[] centerOfMass)
        Set the centerOfMass for this update.
        Description from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the position of the entity center of mass (the body frame origin) with respect to the origin of the entity's structural frame. The components of this vector are resolved onto the coordinate axes of the structural frame.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the translational position of one point with respect to another. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.

      • setBodyWrtStructural

        HlaPayloadUpdater setBodyWrtStructural​(AttitudeQuaternion bodyWrtStructural)
        Set the bodyWrtStructural for this update.
        Description from the FOM: An attitude quaternion that specifies the orientation of an entity's body frame with respect to the entity's structural frame. This attitude quaternion should never change. If not specified, an identity quaternion is assumed.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: This is a quaternion quantifying the orientation of a 'subject' reference frame with respect to some other 'referent' frame. Quaternions consist of one scalar component and a 3-element vector component and can be denoted Q = (s, V), where s is a scalar and V is a vector (x, y, z). Confusion often arises regarding the meaning of the quaternion. (There are several similar but incompatible conventions.) This data type defines a so-called 'left unit transformation quaternion'. It may be used to transform the elements of a vector V_R = (xR, yR, zR) resolved in the referent frame's coordinate axes into the corresponding elements of a vector V_S = (xS, yS, zS) resolved in the subject frame's coordinate axes (i.e. determine the components of the same vector in another coordinate system). The quaternion transformation formula is (0, V_A) = Q . (0, V_B) . Q*, where '.' denotes quaternion multiplication and * denotes quaternion conjugation. The formula for multiplication of the quaternion Q1 = (s1, V1) where V1 is the vector (x1, y1, z1) by the quaternion Q2 = (s2, V2) where V2 is the vector (x2, y2, z2) is Q3 = Q1 . Q2 = (s3, V3) where s3 = s1 s2 - (x1 x2 + y1 y2 + z1 z2) and V3 = (x3, y3, z3) with x3 = s1 x2 + s2 x1 + (y1 z2 - z1 y2), y3 = s1 y2 + s2 y1 + (z1 x2 - x1 z2) and z3 = s1 z2 + s2 z1 + (x1 y2 - y1 x2). The formula for conjugation of the quaternion Q = (s, V), where V is the vector (x, y, z) is Q* = (s, -V) = (s, (-x, -y, -z)).
        Specified by:
        setBodyWrtStructural in interface HlaDynamicalEntityUpdater
        Specified by:
        setBodyWrtStructural in interface HlaPhysicalEntityUpdater
        Parameters:
        bodyWrtStructural - the new bodyWrtStructural
        Returns:
        this updater

      • sendUpdate

        void sendUpdate()
         throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                HlaAttributeNotOwnedException,
                HlaUpdaterReusedException,
                HlaInternalException,
                HlaRtiException,
                HlaObjectInstanceIsRemovedException,
                HlaSaveInProgressException,
                HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Send all the attributes. Note that the Updater can not be reused after sendUpdate has been called.
        Specified by:
        sendUpdate in interface HlaDynamicalEntityUpdater
        Specified by:
        sendUpdate in interface HlaHLAobjectRootUpdater
        Specified by:
        sendUpdate in interface HlaPhysicalEntityUpdater
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaAttributeNotOwnedException - if a changed attribute is not owned
        HlaUpdaterReusedException - if the Updater is reused
        HlaObjectInstanceIsRemovedException - if the object instance has been removed
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress
